title: red brick and black basalt wrap abhishek ajmera’s house in india with tactility
description: the project celebrates exposed brick as both a material and a design language, articulating spatial transitions, filtering light, and tying the interiors to their architectural shell. The post red brick and black basalt wrap abhishek ajmera’s house in india with tactility appeared first on designboom | architecture & design magazine.
author: Abhishek ajmer

title: MM33 Apartment / buno
description: MM33 Apartment rethinks a typical domestic milieu, a commercialized urban housing unit where room sizes are predominantly determined more by the logic of sales and marketing data rather than the dynamics of life. To create more space for flexible usages and for a sense of spaciousness, the rigid sense of room making is challenged, and the assumed standard dimensions are discarded for more meticulously compact scales.
author: Miwa Negoro

title: Core Apartment / BOLO arquitetos
description: We redesigned the entire layout of the apartment to meet the clients' needs. We brought three strong concepts to the project: the truth of the materials, highlighting all the structural elements of the apartment; the tiles, inspired by Lina Bo Bardi's Glass House; and, finally, the curves, which became architectural sculptures and sectored the social and intimate areas.
author: Pilar Caballero

title: The 5 Ceramics of Italy 2025 Tile Trends That Are Shaping Interiors
description: Fresh from the floors of Coverings 2025 in Orlando, Ceramics of Italy has just unveiled its Spring-Summer 2025 Tile Trend Report, and it’s brimming with energy, craftsmanship, and soulful design. This year, Italian ceramic and porcelain tile is rewriting the rules of surfaces. It's not just about finishes and formats anymore; it's about feeling.
author: Erin

title: Before and After: A Brick Home's Coastal Makeover
description: What do you get when you mix a dated red brick home in Australia with the client's request for light, flow, and family function? A showstopping renovation by Modify Homes that turns past limitations into future-proof design. This before-and-after transformation captures the easygoing energy of beachside living through a mix of sculptural curves, smart sustainability, and effortless indoor-outdoor flow.
author: Erin
